alert.note: Alert for Northern Litchfield; Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 16 at 7:20PM EDT until July 17 at 12:10PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following areas, in northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield. In western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Eastern Albany, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene, Rensselaer, Eastern Schenectady, Ulster, Saratoga, Warren, and Washington. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered showers and isolated thunderstorms will produce locally heavy rainfall resulting in the risk for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
